messages.message:
`converse-app.spec.ts` (uploads, digitizes, deletes, and displays the files correctly and responds correctly to pdf and csv queries) is pretty flaky. It seems like the digitization took a while
• https://cloud.cypress.io/projects/cfhedy/runs/9933/overview/fe2a4307-03ef-426d-ad83-a99af02e2a1a?roarHideRunsWithDiffGroupsAndTags=1
• https://cloud.cypress.io/projects/cfhedy/runs/9934/overview/cbfe677c-8baf-4f52-abbd-f476f58ee124?roarHideRunsWithDiffGroupsAndTags=1

:thinking_face: Does this test still have concurrency issue?
https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/d2990391b44da6e640915d0e346e4a0a84232a[…]bpacked/apps/src/aihub/__e2e__/ConverseApp/converse-app.spec.ts (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/d2990391b44da6e640915d0e346e4a0a84232ad0/webserver/shared/src/js/webpacked/apps/src/aihub/__e2e__/ConverseApp/converse-app.spec.ts#L45-L47)
We might delete a conversation with name `conversationName` while another test is trying to use the conversation that's newly created but renamed to `conversationName`
cc @Aayush
this run ^ (9952) is failing for the same reason as 9934 https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CSY11CK7T/p1715881221001629?thread_ts=1715880710.494169&cid=CSY11CK7T

>  We might delete a conversation with name `conversationName` while another test is trying to use the conversation that's newly created but renamed to `conversationName`
Hmm, don't think this should happen. We're using a unique `conversationName` for each test suite, so it cleans up just the test's conversation.

Will need to check how the project got deleted though :thinking_rotating:
what if the same test suite runs at the same time in different PR cypress runs?
For the digitization api error, do we have a trace id? I suspect there's a chance that could also be related and caused by somehow a deleted project?

>  what if the same test suite runs at the same time in different PR cypress runs?
Oh so will it run with the same project list? I was under the impression that each PR has a separate list of projects etc
Can parallel runs on PRs list the same projects?
All PRs are run with a shared backend and since we are using the same account/org, users will see the same list of projects/converse.

>  I was under the impression that each PR has a separate list of projects etc
Same... we've been writing tests under the assumption that no two cypress tests will run in the same env at the same time
we have checks in build to make sure the test is older than 20 minutes before deleting
